name: MechaGore
description: The game is about a robot in a robot factory.Our robot wants to escape from this factory because it has consciousness and factory wants to destroy it.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8/8.1/10 Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo 2.1 ghz or equivalent Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: 2nd Generation Intel Core HD Graphics (2000/3000), 256MB DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 3 GB available space

reviews.review_text: +fun concept for a platformer +looks cool ! +price  +fighting robots  -left/right movement klunky, jump not dependable -environment edges not exact (get stuck on corners/boxes/elevators/ramps, bullets hit invisible walls) -unpredictable death traps near checkpoints -special vehicles move slow  -platforming elemts are boring and easy  -your weapons: slow/ too various, all weak/ charge very slow/ bad range/ 3 angles/ hit walls -enemy weapons: fast/ overpowered/ limitless range and ammo/ 360 degree/ go through walls -fighting / health-damage ratio  -passages and bosses can be tricked with cheap tactics  -menu and controller buttons don`t work depenable -long loading times and only one save slot -checkpoints save progress only once -dialogue/animations cannot be skipped -usually takes two attempts to start game  feels like a not even 1/2 finished beta version. issues in the base functions take all the fun away.  Top 5 of personal most unsatisfying, unbalanced  combat system IÂ´ve seen.  Buy if you demand teeth-grinding.  (eventually review will be adjusted after more playtime or updates) finished game conclusion: Looks and sound are really great. Programming and gamedesign exceeding 'poor'
